author: donschoe
content: can we have a launchpad channel?

author: trent_vanepps
content: where is the launchpad github repo?

author: protolambda
content: <@!557201004060213248> The main purpose of the discord is to provide a platform for devs and researchers to talk about their work. If we start a launchpad channel, maybe it should just be the key-management channel if it is technical. For tech-support for regular users, and collecting feedback, I think it is better to have a different channel or discord server. I will ask the people building the launchpad if they are working on something already, and/or maybe other community members will lead this support effort.

author: torfbolt
content: There is already an "ethstaker" discord server, which as far as I understand is meant to provide user support

author: djrtwo
content:
I chatted with the ethstaker folks yesterday, and they are very happy to host general validator community support there 
https://invite.gg/ethstaker

I think the ethstaker discord in addition to the client specific discords will be the best places to direct the (what will be an increasingly large) validator conversation

author: butta
content:
> There is already an "ethstaker" discord server, which as far as I understand is meant to provide user support
<@645357884300853258>  we will try, but for the feedback we still need the launchpad devs to join. We can create a launchpad channel there

author: torfbolt
content: Makes sense, there will be not only user support, but also technical questions & discussions
